intro: Spergulastrum lanuginosum, commonly known as the downy spergola, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its tufted, grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems covered in soft, hairy tissue. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typically blooming in late summer. Spergulastrum lanuginosum is often found in moist, nutrient-rich soils in meadows and along riverbanks.
